intro: Plagiobothrys myosotoides, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Plagiobothrys myosotoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
